client_profile: A couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels with a budget of 490000–895000 EUR. Priorities include cafes, restaurants, and green areas while seeking a quiet residential lifestyle.
must_have: Proximity to cafes and brunch spots
Access to parks and green areas
red_flags: High noise levels from busy streets
High property taxes in certain areas
contradictions: Quiet may limit proximity to vibrant districts
Residential areas may be further from restaurants
Desire for parks could reduce urban choices

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Diverse neighborhoods blend residential comfort with urban amenities.
Strong presence of parks and cultural venues enhances lifestyle.
watch_out: Potential high traffic in central areas may impact noise levels.

top_districts.name: Saint-Gilles
why: Charming streets are loaded with diverse cafes and boutiques.
Active community with cultural festivals creates a lively atmosphere.
watch_out: Some areas may experience noisy nightlife on weekends.
